quotes.quote: Adulthood is like the vet, and we're all the dogs that were excited for the car ride until we realized where we're going.
Adulthood is not an age, but a stage of knowledge of self.
Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything.
For in every adult there dwells the child that was, and in every child there lies the adult that will be.
Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.
The tough thing about adulthood is it starts before you even know it starts.
Adulthood brings with it a pernicious illusion of control.
Adulthood is the ever-shrinking period between childhood and old age. It is the apparent aim of modern industrial societies to reduce this period to a minimum.
Until you're grown-up they send you to reform school. After you're grown-up they send you to the penitentiary.
Adulthood does not exist. Man is an eternal child.
Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.
Adulthood was invented to repair the wounds of childhood.

Adulthood it a glacier encroaching quietly on youth. When it arrives, the stamp of childhood suddenly freezes, capturing us for good in the image of our last act, the pose we struck when the ice of age set in.
Adulthood is knowing that a fully realized character is always more important than the lines.
Adolescence is the conjugator of childhood and adulthood.
People evolve and it's important to not stop evolving just because you've reached adulthood.
Adulthood has something to do with not choosing any of the pure points of view, but living about half of what you really want to live.
Adulthood is like looking both ways before you cross the street and then getting hit by an airplane.
Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.
Once you've raised a child to adulthood, you can only be as demanding as your offspring allow.
Part of adulthood is searching for the people who understand you.
People thought becoming an adult meant that all your acts had consequences; in fact it was just the opposite.
The great challenge of adulthood is holding on to your idealism after you lose your innocence.
Childhood and adulthood were not factors of age but states of mind.
You're a grown-up, and you get to decide what behaviors affect you for five minutes versus what behaviors change you as a person.
Adolescence is a border between childhood and adulthood. Like all borders, it's teeming with energy and fraught with danger.
With adulthood comes responsibility.
A child becomes an adult when he realizes that he has a right not only to be right but also to be wrong.
The great challenge of adulthood is holding on to your idealism after you lose your innocence
The body grows slowly and steadily but the soul grows by leaps and bounds. It may come to its full stature in an hour.
Adulthood can do the most horrific things to the best of people.
Being an adult means accepting those situations where no action is possible.
